title: The Daily Anna- Chapter 14
body:
It’s finally here! I know it’s been a long time since I posted but I needed to catch up on writing, but it’s here now and chapter 15 (the last chapter) is already done, so there will only be a day or two to wait. As always I have to thank @lovesmelikebrandnewstarlight for helping me with this chapter, it wouldn’t be what it is without her, in fact it probably wouldn’t have happened. 

Get your tissues ready! 

Master Post 

Thoughts/feelings (I need validation) 


One of the Perks of Dating Harry Styles is getting fast tracked through a busy airport. One of the perks of having End Stage Kidney Failure and dating Harry Styles is getting super fast tracked through a busy airport and getting on the plane last, just before it takes off.

Anna was tired. Her whole body ached and keeping her eyes open long enough to get her seat belt done up was a struggle. She knew she didn’t have long.  The last week of their trip had been more of a nightmare than a dream. She was on dialysis the whole time and everyone else was by her side, which was lovely and exhausting at the same time. Harry and Ronnie could barely look at each other, Gemma and Gabby were competing to be Anna’s emotional support. Debbie was a wreck and so was John and Anne, Anne was Anna’s Saviour, she knew exactly when Anna had had enough of everyone and when she needed them all back again. The doctors were still reluctant to let Anna go home, 24 hours on a plane wasn’t the best idea in her state, but she insisted so they did everything they could to make the trip as safe as possible. The airlines however, were not so accommodating. It took Harry days to find one that would allow her to fly at all and even then he had to talk them into it.

She was grateful she’d managed to get everything done so it lay secretly in a cloth bag, stored above her head. No one else knew what was in there yet but they would  soon enough. She rested her head against her seat and allowed her eyes to close while the plane took off, trying to ignore the pain in her sides, Harry, on the other hand, refused to sleep. This flight was dangerous, having Anna away from proper medical care at this point could mean a disaster, so he was on the lookout for any signs that her body was shutting down. His eyes stayed transfixed on her while she slept, almost like something out of Twilight, except that he would give anything to be sleeping too. Night quickly turned to day as they chased the sun around the globe and Anna eventually woke up to everyone else snoring away, except Harry.

“How are you feeling An?” he asked softly the second he realised she was awake

“I’m alright H” she smiled, still half asleep.

“Good,” he kissed her forehead “Should we watch some F.R.I.E.N.D.S?”

“No,” Anna shook her head. She didn’t want to concentrate that much, her body was sore, and even though she was awake now she felt drowsy, like she could pass out again any minute.

“You could sing to me though”

“Sing?”

“Yeah” she whispered “your voice makes everything hurt less”

“Alright” he nodded, his accent suddenly thicker, maybe laced with worry.

“If I could fly….”Harry began singing in a hushed tone

“We’re already flying Styles” Anna whispered

“Alright then” he sighed “you tell me what to sing and I’ll sing it”

“Hmmm” she hummed and thought for a  moment “Anna”

Harry chuckled “alright you little narcissist.” he wrapped his arm around her shoulder and brought her in closer so that her head to could rest on his chest and he cleared his throat and began to sing in a whispered tone.

“I don’t want your sympathy, but you don’t know what you do to me oh Anna”  

Anna sat up and little and turned to face Harry. “You can have a little bit of sympathy” she said “Your girlfriend is dying”

Harry’s face fell. He knew Anna was sick. The chances of her getting better at this point were pretty slim but hearing those words escape her mouth made it all the more  real and in that moment, his whole world felt like it was about to come tumbling down. He was probably going to lose her and he didn’t have a clue what the hell he would do if that happened.  Tears filled his eyes and he couldn’t find his words but Anna didn’t mind she simply held him close and savoured the moment.

“There are worse things than death, Styles” she said after a few moments of silence.

“Like grief” he whispered trying to choke back the tears.

“No, like never being brave enough or lucky enough to fall in love. Everyone wants that and I’ve had it. You’re going to be alright H. I’ll be nothing but a blip on your radar, but I hope it I hope it’s a happy blip”

“The happiest, Elliot” he smiled “But you’re more than a blip, you always will be.”

“Not getting tickets to that show of yours might just be the greatest thing that ever happened to me” Anna admitted. This is something that she’d been thinking about a lot lately, the smallest things add up to and become the best most life changing things. If she got those tickets, Ronnie would never have even thought of getting her a backstage pass, and she would have had the greatest night of her life at that show but after that, everything would have gone back to normal, instead, she got to see the show, meet Harry and fall in love. What else could she ask for in her short little life?

“Meeting that fake intern at my show was probably the best thing that has ever happened to me”

“I could think of a lot of pretty great things that have happened to you Styles”

“That’s just work” he said “This is so much more”

The flight drew on for a few more hours and Anna dozed in and out of sleep, but Harry powered through his exhaustion and continued to keep an eye on Anna. Her skin was paler than usual and her breaths slowed while she slept. But Harry knew that that was Ok, it meant that her body was resting, willing itself to survive just a few more hours. The others all slept too, until an hour before the plane was due to land in Dubai for a quick refuel. The stopover wasn’t even long enough for them to get out, but it meant that there was only eight hours to go and that gave Anna some hope. Everyone had pretty much kept to themselves for the trip but just as the seatbelt lights disappeared again and the plane was safely in the air, Ronnie appeared behind Harry’s seat and rested his hand on Harry’s shoulder. Confused by the gesture, Harry turned around to look at him.

“This is all a bit ridiculous don’t you think?” Ronnie said

“What is?” Harry’s temper was short

“Us hating each other, look at her” Ronnie gestured towards a sleeping Anna “she’s dying and we can’t even look at each other just because we’re jealous of the other”

Harry took a deep breath, he knew Ronnie was right but as far as he could see, he had nothing to apologize for, Ronnie was in the wrong.

“This is a bit ridiculous” he agreed

“I’m sorry for the way I’ve acted since you met Anna” Ronnie said holding his hand out

“That’s alright” Harry said shaking Ronnie’s hand “sorry for being weird once I found out you two had a history”

“Truce” Ronnie nodded “You haven’t slept a second since we got on this plane, I’ll sit with her for a while, you get some rest”

Harry looked at Anna sleeping so peacefully and nodded and back at Ronnie. He didn’t want to leave her, but his eyes were so heavy and he wasn’t sure that he would be able to stay awake for the rest of the flight, and that could be worse than having ronnie next to her.

“Thank you” Harry nodded and stood up, allowing Ronnie to sit.

It  didn’t take long  however before things started to turn sour, but it wasn’t Ronnie who noticed, it was Gemma.

“Her skin is awfully yellow” she said as she walked past their seats on her way back from the bathroom.

That was a bad sign, it meant that not only were her kidneys failing, but all the toxins in her blood were causing her liver to fail too.

“I thought that was just the lighting in here” Ronnie admitted turning bright red with both embarrassment and worry.

“Wake her up” Gemma said, crouching down next to Anna.

Ronnie did as he was told and tried his best to wake her, but she wouldn’t budge.

“Anna Sweetie, I need you to wake up now” Gemma said softly, her voice shaking. The flight attendants started to catch on to what was happening and made their way over, just as Anna opened her eyes.

“What’s going on?” she blinked

“You’re looking a little Jaundice love” Gemma said “I need you to stay awake now, the doctors said this might happen, and if it did then we should keep you alert”

“Ok” Anna nodded turning to around to find that Ronnie was sitting in Harry’s spot “Ron, where’s H? What’s going on?”

“It’s alright An, he’s just over there, having a sleep”

“Is he alright?” she asked, a little dazed and light headed.

“He’s fine, just sleeping, don’t worry about him” Gemma said, “We’ve got three hours left until we land, and I need you to stay awake An, can you do that for me?”

Anna nodded.

“Alright. I’ll come and sit with you in just a minute” she said eyeing off Ronnie, confused as to why Harry and swapped with him in the first place, having missed the entire conversation that they’d had.

“Is she alright?” the flight attendant asked Gemma.

“This isn’t a good sign” she said in response “but there’s nothing that can be done until we can get her to a hospital”

“We can have an ambulance on standby for when we land if it’s urgent” the attendant said

Gemma thought for a second and the nodded, looking back at Anna “I think that’s best”

Nothing got better from there. Anna couldn’t stay awake, she passed out only about fifteen minutes after Gemma spoke to the flight attendants and after that it was just a waiting game. They kept a close eye on her breathing and when it quickened they gave her oxygen, which helped, but it wasn’t her lungs that were the problem now, it was her heart. Her blood was now so full of potassium, that it was stopping her heart. Everyone was panicked now, there was nothing they could do to help her until they landed, so instead they hovered over her, watching her every movement until the seatbelt light switched on and the disaster of a flight came to and end.

The wheels touched down on the tarmac and the paramedics barged their way into the cabin to attend to Anna before anyone was allowed to move off the plane. They wheeled her off as quickly as they could with Harry and Debbie trailing closely behind.
“I’m so sorry Mr Styles” a flight attendant said, stepping in between Harry and the paramedics “this is an international flight, I can’t let you go without going through customs first”

He could argue all he liked, but she wasn’t going to budge on the idea, so he simply nodded and turned back around in defeat.

They were all ushered off the plane first and once again, the advantage of being Harry Styles took over and they were fast tracked through customs and left to wait at baggage claim for the system to catch up with them.

“You go” Gemma said to Harry and Anna’s family “Mum and I will wait for the bags”

“I’ll stay and help” Ronnie said. He couldn’t go, he didn’t want to watch her die, he’d been by her side since they were two years old, and watching her die felt like losing a whole chunk of who he is. He couldn’t go. Besides, this time there’d be no Anna to make him smile despite their tears when Timmy died because she’d be the one he was losing.

“She’d want you there mate” Harry said

“I can’t” he shook his head “I’ll stay back”

They didn’t know where Anna had been taken, in the rush of it all, not a single one of them thought to ask the paramedics which of many hospitals in London they were taking her to. Debbie, John and Gabby weren’t a lot of help either, they didn’t know London very well and they were too worried to be thinking straight.

“Her regular Hospital Harry, that’s where they would have taken her” Gabby said while they sat in the cab, unsure of what to tell the driver.

“That’s so far from here” he frowned “They would have taken her to the closest one”

“Excuse me?” Debbie said to the driver “What’s the name of the closest hospital?”

“That’d be Hillingdon” he said in thick London accent “That where we’re headed?”

“I’ll ring them first” Harry said with his phone already up to his ear. The tone rang for a few seconds for them all to hear but when Harry started to speak, they couldn’t hear the person at the other end.

“Hi, could you tell me if a patient has been taken to your hospital….in an ambulance, about 40 minutes ago, ….. Anna Elliot……. Alright, thank you for your help.”  He hung up the phone, telling the driver to head to the emergency department at the Hillingdon hospital. The short drive felt like it took hours.  None of them spoke, all of them silent wondering if Anna was still breathing. When the cab eventually pulled up they jumped out  as quickly as they could and rushed inside.

“I was told Anna Elliot was brought here by ambulance” Harry said to the girl on the desk who was typing away, uninterested in Harry’s concern.

“Are you her husband?”

“No” Harry said “Her boyfriend”

“Only immediate family, you’ll have to wait out here”

The girl lead the others in,leaving Harry to wait on his own and all he could think about was Anna and Gabby, waiting in the waiting room while Timmy died. His heart ached, Anna was in there, in so much pain he wasn’t there by her side like he’d promised that he would be. In an effort to keep himself distracted he let Anne, Gemma and Ronnie know where they were but the ticking clock was the only sound in the room and it was starting to drive him crazy. It was the middle of the day, people were in and out of the waiting room, going about their business, untouched by the worry or nervousness that plagued Harry.

Hours passed and he’d not heard anything but at least now he had Anne, Gemma and Ronnie sitting with him. It didn’t make it any easier, but there was comfort in having his family there with him.

“Why don’t you go ask someone love?” Anne asked after a while.

“I’m not immediate family” Harry replied, staring straight at the white wall in front of him

“They might be able to give you some idea about what’s going on, it’s worth a shot”

Harry’s chest tightened as he stood, making his way over to the desk, which was now being manned by a different nurse.

“Hi” he said softly “is it possible to get an update on a patient”

“Of course” she smiled. Much kinder than the last “what was their name”

“Anna Elliot”

She typed the name into the computer and grimaced at the screen. “She’s been taken to the ICU, in a critical condition. Are you family?”

“No” he shook his head

“Visiting hours don’t start for another hour, so I can’t let you in until then, but she’s in room 24c, and the ICU is on the fourth floor”

“Thank you” he nodded and turned back to sit with  Anne Gemma and Ronnie.

“She’s in the ICU, we can see her in an hour” he said softly.

“Did she say how she was doing?” Gemma asked

“Critical condition” was all that Harry could manage. He didn’t really know what that meant, was she ok? Was she still fighting her own body to stay alive?

Nobody said anything after that, they were scared, but they were also jetlagged. Ronnie wanted to sleep. Gemma could barely keep her eyes open but Anne wide awake with Harry, holding his hand as they waited for that hour to pass. This was all too familiar to her and the last thing she wanted was for her son to feel the same way she did just over a year ago. She needed him to know that he wasn’t alone in this. The clock ticked and tocked and eventually the hour was up and they were able to go and see her. Harry’s mouth was dry and he couldn’t form a coherent thought as they rode the elevator to the fourth floor. The lights up here were bright and unnatural and it smelt like hand sanitiser. The uncomfortable silence was filled with the sounds of dozens of machines beeping all at once.   Ronnie spotted Gabby, sitting outside a room, tears filling her eyes. He didn’t say anything to her, he simply held his hand out and engulfed her in a hug. As much as he wanted to comfort Gabby too, Harry had to know what was going on with Anna, so he barged past them, into room 24c.

Anna was unconscious, connected to dozens of machines that were buzzing and whirring around her. She looked peaceful.

“How is she?” Harry asked, looking between John and Debbie who were sitting next to each other in the corner of the room, just staring at Anna.

“She’s…she’s” Debbie started, but she couldn’t finish the sentence.

“This is it Harry” John took over “It’s just a waiting game now, could be hours, could be days”

“Will she wake?” Harry wasn’t sure if he wanted to know the answer to this, bit it was the only thing he could think to ask.

Both her parents shook their heads and Harry’s eyes filled with tears again except this time he couldn’t stop them from falling.

“We’ll leave you two for a while” John said as he and Debbie left the room.

Harry pulled a chair closer to Anna’s bed and sat down beside her, grabbing onto her hand and kissing it.

“ I never told you this An, and I don’t even know if you can hear me now, but the night of the second show in London, just after we met, you asked what ‘Anna’ was about and I said a feeling. You’re that feeling An, I wrote it about a feeling I’d never had before, then I saw you and I knew, and it helped that your name is Anna” he giggled a little through the tears. Talking to her felt pointless, but there was so much that he never got to say. “You changed my life Anna Elliot, in the best way possible, you came in and turned everything upside down and gave me the happiest six months I’ve ever had, and now everything’s going to be right side up again and I don’t know what I’m going to do”

Before Harry had the chance to say anything else a nurse came into the room, a sympathetic look on her face “I’m sorry sir, visiting hours are over”

Besides, this time there’d be no Anna to make him smile despite their tears when Timmy died because she’d be the one he was losing.

“She’d want you there mate” Harry said

“I can’t” he shook his head “I’ll stay back”

They didn’t know where Anna had been taken, in the rush of it all, not a single one of them thought to ask the paramedics which of many hospitals in London they were taking her to. Debbie, John and Gabby weren’t a lot of help either, they didn’t know London very well and they were too worried to be thinking straight.

“Her regular Hospital Harry, that’s where they would have taken her” Gabby said while they sat in the cab, unsure of what to tell the driver.

“That’s so far from here” he frowned “They would have taken her to the closest one”

“Excuse me?” Debbie said to the driver “What’s the name of the closest hospital?”

“That’d be Hillingdon” he said in thick London accent “That where we’re headed?”

“I’ll ring them first” Harry said with his phone already up to his ear. The tone rang for a few seconds for them all to hear but when Harry started to speak, they couldn’t hear the person at the other end.

“Hi, could you tell me if a patient has been taken to your hospital….in an ambulance, about 40 minutes ago, ….. Anna Elliot……. Alright, thank you for your help.”  He hung up the phone, telling the driver to head to the emergency department at the Hillingdon hospital. When the cab eventually pulled up they jumped out  as quickly as they could and rushed inside.

“I was told Anna Elliot was brought here by ambulance” Harry said to the girl on the desk who was typing away, uninterested in Harry’s concern.

“Are you her husband?”

“No” Harry said “Her boyfriend”

“Only immediate family, you’ll have to wait out here”

The girl lead the others in,leaving Harry to wait on his own and all he could think about was Anna and Gabby, waiting in the waiting room while Timmy died. His heart ached, Anna was in there, in so much pain he wasn’t there by her side like he’d promised that he would be. In an effort to keep himself distracted he let Anne, Gemma and Ronnie know where they were but the ticking clock was the only sound in the room and it was starting to drive him crazy. It was the middle of the day, people were in and out of the waiting room, going about their business, untouched by the worry or nervousness that plagued Harry.

Hours passed and he’d not heard anything but at least now he had Anne, Gemma and Ronnie sitting with him. It didn’t make it any easier, but there was comfort in having his family there with him.

“Why don’t you go ask someone love?” Anne asked after a while.

“I’m not immediate family” Harry replied, staring straight at the white wall in front of him

“They might be able to give you some idea about what’s going on, it’s worth a shot”

“Hi” he said softly “is it possible to get an update on a patient”

“Of course” she smiled. Much kinder than the last “what was their name”

“Anna Elliot”

She typed the name into the computer and grimaced at the screen. “She’s been taken to the ICU, in a critical condition. Are you family?”

“Thank you” he nodded and turned back to sit with  Anne Gemma and Ronnie.

“She’s in the ICU, we can see her in an hour” he said softly.

Debbie was a wreck and so was John and Anne, Anne was Anna’s Saviour, she knew exactly when Anna had had enough of everyone and when she needed them all back again. The doctors were still reluctant to let Anna go home, 24 hours on a plane wasn’t the best idea in her state, but she insisted so they did everything they could to make the trip as safe as possible. The airlines however, were not so accommodating. It took Harry days to find one that would allow her to fly at all and even then he had to talk them into it.

[[MORE]]

“You could sing to me though”

“Sing?”

“Alright” he nodded, his accent suddenly thicker, maybe laced with worry.

“If I could fly….”Harry began singing in a hushed tone

“Alright then” he sighed “you tell me what to sing and I’ll sing it”

“The happiest, Elliot” he smiled “But you’re more than a blip, you always will be.”

“I could think of a lot of pretty great things that have happened to you Styles”

“Us hating each other, look at her” Ronnie gestured towards a sleeping Anna “she’s dying and we can’t even look at each other just because we’re jealous of the other”

Harry took a deep breath, he knew Ronnie was right but as far as he could see, he had nothing to apologize for, Ronnie was in the wrong.

“This is a bit ridiculous” he agreed

“I’m sorry for the way I’ve acted since you met Anna” Ronnie said holding his hand out

“That’s alright” Harry said shaking Ronnie’s hand “sorry for being weird once I found out you two had a history”

“Truce” Ronnie nodded “You haven’t slept a second since we got on this plane, I’ll sit with her for a while, you get some rest”

Harry looked at Anna sleeping so peacefully and nodded and back at Ronnie. He didn’t want to leave her, but his eyes were so heavy and he wasn’t sure that he would be able to stay awake for the rest of the flight, and that could be worse than having ronnie next to her.

“Thank you” Harry nodded and stood up, allowing Ronnie to sit.

It  didn’t take long  however before things started to turn sour, but it wasn’t Ronnie who noticed, it was Gemma.

“Her skin is awfully yellow” she said as she walked past their seats on her way back from the bathroom.

That was a bad sign, it meant that not only were her kidneys failing, but all the toxins in her blood were causing her liver to fail too.

“I thought that was just the lighting in here” Ronnie admitted turning bright red with both embarrassment and worry.

“Wake her up” Gemma said, crouching down next to Anna.

Ronnie did as he was told and tried his best to wake her, but she wouldn’t budge.

“Anna Sweetie, I need you to wake up now” Gemma said softly, her voice shaking. The flight attendants started to catch on to what was happening and made their way over, just as Anna opened her eyes.

“What’s going on?” she blinked

“You’re looking a little Jaundice love” Gemma said “I need you to stay awake now, the doctors said this might happen, and if it did then we should keep you alert”

“Ok” Anna nodded turning to around to find that Ronnie was sitting in Harry’s spot “Ron, where’s H? What’s going on?”

“It’s alright An, he’s just over there, having a sleep”

“Is he alright?” she asked, a little dazed and light headed.

“He’s fine, just sleeping, don’t worry about him” Gemma said, “We’ve got three hours left until we land, and I need you to stay awake An, can you do that for me?”

Anna nodded.

“Alright. I’ll come and sit with you in just a minute” she said eyeing off Ronnie, confused as to why Harry and swapped with him in the first place, having missed the entire conversation that they’d had.

“Is she alright?” the flight attendant asked Gemma.

“This isn’t a good sign” she said in response “but there’s nothing that can be done until we can get her to a hospital”

“We can have an ambulance on standby for when we land if it’s urgent” the attendant said

Gemma thought for a second and the nodded, looking back at Anna “I think that’s best”

Nothing got better from there. Anna couldn’t stay awake, she passed out only about fifteen minutes after Gemma spoke to the flight attendants and after that it was just a waiting game. They kept a close eye on her breathing and when it quickened they gave her oxygen, which helped, but it wasn’t her lungs that were the problem now, it was her heart. Her blood was now so full of potassium, that it was stopping her heart. Everyone was panicked now, there was nothing they could do to help her until they landed, so instead they hovered over her, watching her every movement until the seatbelt light switched on and the disaster of a flight came to and end.

The wheels touched down on the tarmac and the paramedics barged their way into the cabin to attend to Anna before anyone was allowed to move off the plane. They wheeled her off as quickly as they could with Harry and Debbie trailing closely behind.
“I’m so sorry Mr Styles” a flight attendant said, stepping in between Harry and the paramedics “this is an international flight, I can’t let you go without going through customs first”

He could argue all he liked, but she wasn’t going to budge on the idea, so he simply nodded and turned back around in defeat.

They were all ushered off the plane first and once again, the advantage of being Harry Styles took over and they were fast tracked through customs and left to wait at baggage claim for the system to catch up with them.

“You go” Gemma said to Harry and Anna’s family “Mum and I will wait for the bags”

“I’ll stay and help” Ronnie said. He couldn’t go, he didn’t want to watch her die, he’d been by her side since they were two years old, and watching her die felt like losing a whole chunk of who he is. He couldn’t go. Besides, this time there’d be no Anna to make him smile despite their tears when Timmy died because she’d be the one he was losing.

“She’d want you there mate” Harry said

“I can’t” he shook his head “I’ll stay back”

They didn’t know where Anna had been taken, in the rush of it all, not a single one of them thought to ask the paramedics which of many hospitals in London they were taking her to. Debbie, John and Gabby weren’t a lot of help either, they didn’t know London very well and they were too worried to be thinking straight.

“Her regular Hospital Harry, that’s where they would have taken her” Gabby said while they sat in the cab, unsure of what to tell the driver.

“That’s so far from here” he frowned “They would have taken her to the closest one”

“Excuse me?” Debbie said to the driver “What’s the name of the closest hospital?”

“That’d be Hillingdon” he said in thick London accent “That where we’re headed?”

“I’ll ring them first” Harry said with his phone already up to his ear. The tone rang for a few seconds for them all to hear but when Harry started to speak, they couldn’t hear the person at the other end.

“Hi, could you tell me if a patient has been taken to your hospital….in an ambulance, about 40 minutes ago, ….. Anna Elliot……. Alright, thank you for your help.”  He hung up the phone, telling the driver to head to the emergency department at the Hillingdon hospital. The short drive felt like it took hours.  None of them spoke, all of them silent wondering if Anna was still breathing. When the cab eventually pulled up they jumped out  as quickly as they could and rushed inside.

“I was told Anna Elliot was brought here by ambulance” Harry said to the girl on the desk who was typing away, uninterested in Harry’s concern.

“Are you her husband?”

“No” Harry said “Her boyfriend”

“Only immediate family, you’ll have to wait out here”

The girl lead the others in,leaving Harry to wait on his own and all he could think about was Anna and Gabby, waiting in the waiting room while Timmy died. His heart ached, Anna was in there, in so much pain he wasn’t there by her side like he’d promised that he would be. In an effort to keep himself distracted he let Anne, Gemma and Ronnie know where they were but the ticking clock was the only sound in the room and it was starting to drive him crazy. It was the middle of the day, people were in and out of the waiting room, going about their business, untouched by the worry or nervousness that plagued Harry.

Hours passed and he’d not heard anything but at least now he had Anne, Gemma and Ronnie sitting with him. It didn’t make it any easier, but there was comfort in having his family there with him.

“Why don’t you go ask someone love?” Anne asked after a while.

“I’m not immediate family” Harry replied, staring straight at the white wall in front of him

“They might be able to give you some idea about what’s going on, it’s worth a shot”

Harry’s chest tightened as he stood, making his way over to the desk, which was now being manned by a different nurse.

“Hi” he said softly “is it possible to get an update on a patient”

“Of course” she smiled. Much kinder than the last “what was their name”

“Anna Elliot”

She typed the name into the computer and grimaced at the screen. “She’s been taken to the ICU, in a critical condition. Are you family?”

“No” he shook his head

“Visiting hours don’t start for another hour, so I can’t let you in until then, but she’s in room 24c, and the ICU is on the fourth floor”

“Thank you” he nodded and turned back to sit with  Anne Gemma and Ronnie.

“She’s in the ICU, we can see her in an hour” he said softly.

“Did she say how she was doing?” Gemma asked

“Critical condition” was all that Harry could manage. He didn’t really know what that meant, was she ok? Was she still fighting her own body to stay alive?

Nobody said anything after that, they were scared, but they were also jetlagged. Ronnie wanted to sleep. Gemma could barely keep her eyes open but Anne wide awake with Harry, holding his hand as they waited for that hour to pass. This was all too familiar to her and the last thing she wanted was for her son to feel the same way she did just over a year ago. She needed him to know that he wasn’t alone in this. The clock ticked and tocked and eventually the hour was up and they were able to go and see her. Harry’s mouth was dry and he couldn’t form a coherent thought as they rode the elevator to the fourth floor. The lights up here were bright and unnatural and it smelt like hand sanitiser. The uncomfortable silence was filled with the sounds of dozens of machines beeping all at once.   Ronnie spotted Gabby, sitting outside a room, tears filling her eyes. He didn’t say anything to her, he simply held his hand out and engulfed her in a hug. As much as he wanted to comfort Gabby too, Harry had to know what was going on with Anna, so he barged past them, into room 24c.

Anna was unconscious, connected to dozens of machines that were buzzing and whirring around her. She looked peaceful.

“How is she?” Harry asked, looking between John and Debbie who were sitting next to each other in the corner of the room, just staring at Anna.

“She’s…she’s” Debbie started, but she couldn’t finish the sentence.

“This is it Harry” John took over “It’s just a waiting game now, could be hours, could be days”

“Will she wake?” Harry wasn’t sure if he wanted to know the answer to this, bit it was the only thing he could think to ask.

Both her parents shook their heads and Harry’s eyes filled with tears again except this time he couldn’t stop them from falling.

“We’ll leave you two for a while” John said as he and Debbie left the room.

Harry pulled a chair closer to Anna’s bed and sat down beside her, grabbing onto her hand and kissing it.

“ I never told you this An, and I don’t even know if you can hear me now, but the night of the second show in London, just after we met, you asked what ‘Anna’ was about and I said a feeling. You’re that feeling An, I wrote it about a feeling I’d never had before, then I saw you and I knew, and it helped that your name is Anna” he giggled a little through the tears. Talking to her felt pointless, but there was so much that he never got to say. “You changed my life Anna Elliot, in the best way possible, you came in and turned everything upside down and gave me the happiest six months I’ve ever had, and now everything’s going to be right side up again and I don’t know what I’m going to do”

Before Harry had the chance to say anything else a nurse came into the room, a sympathetic look on her face “I’m sorry sir, visiting hours are over”
trail.content_abstract:
It’s finally here! I know it’s been a long time since I posted but I needed to catch up on writing, but it’s here now and chapter 15 (the last chapter) is already done, so there will only be a day or two to wait. As always I have to thank @lovesmelikebrandnewstarlight for helping me with this chapter, it wouldn’t be what it is without her, in fact it probably wouldn’t have happened. 

Get your tissues ready! 

Master Post 

Thoughts/feelings (I need validation) 


One of the Perks of Dating Harry Styles is getting fast tracked through a busy airport. One of the perks of having End Stage Kidney Failure and dating Harry Styles is getting super fast tracked through a busy airport and getting on the plane last, just before it takes off.

Anna was tired. Her whole body ached and keeping her eyes open long enough to get her seat belt done up was a struggle. She knew she didn’t have long.  The last week of their trip had been more of a nightmare than a dream. She was on dialysis the whole time and everyone else was by her side, which was lovely and exhausting at the same time. Harry and Ronnie could barely look at each other, Gemma and Gabby were competing to be Anna’s emotional support. Debbie was a wreck and so was John and Anne, Anne was Anna’s Saviour, she knew exactly when Anna had had enough of everyone and when she needed them all back again. The doctors were still reluctant to let Anna go home, 24 hours on a plane wasn’t the best idea in her state, but she insisted so they did everything they could to make the trip as safe as possible. The airlines however, were not so accommodating. It took Harry days to find one that would allow her to fly at all and even then he had to talk them into it.

summary: Hi, I saw your post about zayn and I thought I was the only one who thought that about what he did. I'm glad that someone else...
question: Hi, I saw your post about zayn and I thought I was the only one who thought that about what he did. I'm glad that someone else sees how fake he is
answer:
Hi Hun!

Oh yeah, as time went on, I started to realize that Zayn didn’t leave for his well-being. He’d been longing for that solo career of his for Lord knows how long. Instead of him being a mature young man and talking it out with everyone, he took those few days off to think about how he would leave. So, of course, he would use the marijuana incident and hardcore partying as a way of saying, “I’m not doing so good. I need to leave.”

My thing is this: if he was going to lie about his crippling mentality, at least stick with the lie. Because then you’ll lose your friends AND fans once we’ve caught you in the act of pursuing a solo career you claimed you despised.

summary: Sidekick of a Superstar - Chapter 46 Hershey
title: Sidekick of a Superstar - Chapter 46 Hershey
body:
Oi, oi! I got faster a bit. 

Word count: 2k

You thought it’s gonna bring you closer, but you felt Harry distancing. You did the same though. Still, there was an undeniable love between the two of you. You sat in your hotel room in Harry’s jacket from last night. You were sure he’s looking for it. You stole it when he took it off last night in the dressing room. It was a bit sweaty, but you smelled his scent in it, so you slept in it. Now, in the morning you decided to leave it on and preparing for the next few days. You made a shopping list and there were plans for the day off too. Mostly work, since Harry decided to be an executive producer and also he had long phone calls with Alessandro Michele or someone else from Gucci. They didn’t tell you yet, but they were up to something big.

“Uhm.. I was thinking if you knew where I put my jacket last night” Harry said in the phone.

“You put it on the couch in your dressing room” you answered.

“Do you think I left it there?”

“No, I stole it” you smiled.

“Hey! You still haven’t given me back the Palomo jacket you took” he pouted.

“You have other ones and you don’t even wear them. Stop whining!” you said.

“Okay. See you at the car” he said.

“See ya!”

Next phone call was Lottie’s.

“So I looked through the photos from the tour and something’s weird” she started.

“Hello maybe?”

“Sorry. Hi, am I interrupting?”

“No”

“Then I’ll go on. So, the picture from Dallas. Kacey and Harry” you groaned. You got enough of hearing that two names together. “What?”

“Nothing, I just hear Kacey and Harry from everywhere now. Like they were some power couple.’

“Well, they seem to be good friends and you know that the media loves putting Harry together with any girl that is around him”

“Yes, I know it, I’m his personal assistant and I read every article about him. But I am his bloody girlfriend and I know people don’t know that, but I’m sick of living in the background”

“Oh, love, if I knew it makes you upset, I don’t bring it up” you sat down on your bed finally and almost started crying.

“No, I’m overreacting, but I don’t know how long I can go like this”

“I’m sorry, love”

“What did you wanna say?”

“Actually that Kacey looks weird on that picture, like she was a wax figure” she said and you chuckled a bit.

“I thought you’re gonna say they look like a perfect couple.”

“First, you’re paranoid. Second, I wouldn’t tell you that even if I thought that.”

“Thanks!”

“Now get out of your room and kiss your wonderful boyfriend. I’ll go and make a tea to watch a romantic movie to fall asleep on”

“Thank you for calling”

“Anytime, darling” you hung up and went to see Harry. He was still in his room. You walked in and he was lying on the bed still. He was reading a book.

“Good morning, love” he said with a husky voice. You didn’t say anything but kissed him.

“Mmm, I missed that” he said with eyes brighter than the sun.

“Come on, let’s have breakfast”

After breakfast everyone left to Hershey. The trip was filled with work mostly. Everyone was occupied. Harry was working hard with Jeff, but he promised that the evening is yours. You didn’t mind, because you were with Sarah and Clare that afternoon, rehearsing your surprise for the karaoke party. You even chose the right outfits for it and ordered it. You made a little choreography for the song you wanted to perform. It was the kind of fun you missed. You were with Harry almost 24/7, and you missed being silly with girls. Time flew and it was 7 already. The girls left your room a half an hour ago and Harry promised to come at 7. You were sitting on your bed, waiting for him. It was 7.15 when you got up and started walking around. A sigh left your mouth when he rushed in.

“I’m so sorry, I was on the phone” he apologized while he walked in with your favourite sweets in his hands. He gave you a kiss and then sat down with you on the bed. You agreed on watching While You Were Sleeping. You cuddled in bed until you fell asleep. You couldn’t tell if he stayed the night, because he was out by the morning.

As you arrived early in Hershey Park Stadium, you saw that Harry is already there. He was playing baseball with some of the crew members. This venue was open-air so it was a bit different from the others. But you loved it, the sun was shining and it brought you a better mood that you were in yesterday. Harry waved to you as he saw you. You waved back. You met Jeff as you went backstage.

“Good morning” he said.

“Good morning”

“Did Harry call you?”

“No, but I saw him playing outside”

“I mean Lambert”

“Oh, no. Haven’t talked with him in the last few days”

“I think he’s gonna call you now” he smiled.

“Okay?” it was more of a question. You didn’t know what this is about, but you sat down next to Jeff and jumped into work immediately. You were working together this day. After a half an hour Harry walked in.

“Heey!” you heard him. He walked behind you and kissed the top of your head.

“What are you working at?” He sat down beside you.

“Right now? Making appointments for a check up. Everyone needs to be tested again” you said.

“So I have to stop with drugs, right?” he joked. He leaned very close to your ear. You felt his breath on your skin. “But you’re my only drug” he whispered. You blushed a bit.

“Then don’t ever stop with that” you whispered back. He smirked. He left you two to finish work. You smiled and thought maybe you could work it through and it felt good. A little later you saw Harry widely smiling and laughing a bit far from you. You smiled but then you saw that he’s with Kacey again. You realized that you haven’t seen that kind of smile on his face recently when he was with you. It made your heart break. Jeff noticed that your mood turned upside down in one second.

“y/n, you can tell me what’s going on. I won’t tell Harry if you don’t want me to.”

“I don’t know Jeff, I don’t feel what I used to feel. I’m insecure all the time” you said.

“I think it’s because of the messages, but it was just a psycho’s game. Talk to him. You know him. You know you can talk to him” he advised.

“I can’t, Jeff. That’s the problem. I can’t even talk to him like that.”

“In my opinion it would be better if you’d try. Or write it down, but let him know how you feel” he said.

“Okay” you sighed.  As time passed and you finished the paperwork, you walked through the place and watched as the crew members work hard on preparing the venue for the show. Sarah waved to you and you walked to her. She sat on one of the seats.

“Hey, girl!” she said.

“Hey! What’s up?” you sat down next to her.

“I loved yesterday afternoon. I think the karaoke party will be so much fun” she said.

“Oh, yeah! Was it your idea?”

“Yeah, then I told Clare that we should do it together. She loved it. And we loved your idea about the matching outfits”

“Thanks” you smiled.

“You got used to be in matching clothes with Harry, right?”

“Yeah” you chuckled.

“Look, it’s none of my business, but you two don’t seem to be madly in love. Is it because you don’t want to expose your relationship, or you distanced?” she asked. You sighed and looked down at your hands.

“I… we… I want… I think we distanced a bit. There was something going on recently”

“Is it something to do with Mike? I heard that he was taken by the police and I haven’t seen him since”

“Uhm, yeah. But it’s confidential, so I can’t tell you details. But it ruined us a bit and we still haven’t talk it through. I mean, I thought we’ll get closer by the time and stuff but it seems we’re just drifting away from each other” you admitted.

“No, I don’t want that. You are a great pair. I already planned double dates with you two and Mitch” she said. You chuckled a bit.

“That would be nice, if we’re still together after tour”

“I don’t want t hear anything like that. You’re gonna solve it, I’m sure” she said. You wanted to react but you saw the sound engineer wave to you to come down. You went together and soundcheck started.

Harry smiled at you several times and you tried your best to smile back. It was hard with Kacey next to you. At some point you were doubting Harry smiles at you or Kacey. As soundcheck finished you got dressed in the most beautiful skirt you’ve ever seen. It was the same colour as Harry’s suit tonight. As you walked out of your dressing room you saw Harry by the stage but still in the back. He stood there like a dream. Kacey was on stage, doing the pre-show and he watched it. You saw Helene capture the moment, you smiled. You wanted to go and hug him casually but you knew that anyone could see you in a venue like this. You were sure even some fans saw Harry standing there. When he saw you watching him, he waved you to go there. You stood next to him.

“You know that I love you, right?” he asked still looking at the show. You looked at him and he looked at you. You couldn’t answer and he saw that in your eyes.

“I love you, Harry” you said and you both turned your eyes back to the stage as Kacey finished her last song. Harry walked away to get ready and you just stayed there in your beautiful luxury clothes in a sold out venue watching your boyfriend, Harry Styles and you thought you should be happy. But you felt empty. You almost started crying, but you felt a hand on your back. You turned right and Louis stood there smiling. You smiled back. You were so emotional at that point that you hugged him tight.

“Oi, girl” he chuckled. He stayed with you the whole show and you two danced together to the songs. And when you cried during Sign of the Times, Just a Little Bit of Your Heart, Sweet Creature, If I Could Fly he gave you a tissue every time. After Harry did the whale he ran off stage and stopped by you. He was hyped and smiled widely.

“Did you enjoy it?” he asked.

“A lot” you smiled and gave a kiss on his cheek. You three went back to the hotel together. When you were in the car, Louis spoke up.

“Guys, I wanted to tell you that I gotta go back to the UK tomorrow. I’ll try to come back as often as I can, but I got a great opportunity” he said.

“What?”

“I was offered a seat in the X-Factor judges” he smiled.

“Oh my!” you were surprised.

“Wow! That’s great. With Simon?” Harry asked.

“Yeah, it’s funny, right?”

“It’s hilarious and amazing” Harry added.

“I’m gonna miss you both” Lou said.

You were quite sad that he leaves because you became good friends since you first met him. reblog.comment:
Oi, oi! I got faster a bit. 

Word count: 2k

You thought it’s gonna bring you closer, but you felt Harry distancing. You did the same though. Still, there was an undeniable love between the two of you. You sat in your hotel room in Harry’s jacket from last night. You were sure he’s looking for it. You stole it when he took it off last night in the dressing room. It was a bit sweaty, but you smelled his scent in it, so you slept in it. Now, in the morning you decided to leave it on and preparing for the next few days. You made a shopping list and there were plans for the day off too. Mostly work, since Harry decided to be an executive producer and also he had long phone calls with Alessandro Michele or someone else from Gucci. They didn’t tell you yet, but they were up to something big.

“Uhm.. I was thinking if you knew where I put my jacket last night” Harry said in the phone.

“You put it on the couch in your dressing room” you answered.

“Do you think I left it there?”

“No, I stole it” you smiled.

“Hey! You still haven’t given me back the Palomo jacket you took” he pouted.

“You have other ones and you don’t even wear them. Stop whining!” you said.

“Okay. See you at the car” he said.

“See ya!”

Next phone call was Lottie’s.

“So I looked through the photos from the tour and something’s weird” she started.

“Hello maybe?”

“Sorry. Hi, am I interrupting?”

“No”

“Then I’ll go on. So, the picture from Dallas. Kacey and Harry” you groaned. You got enough of hearing that two names together. “What?”

“Nothing, I just hear Kacey and Harry from everywhere now. Like they were some power couple.’

“Well, they seem to be good friends and you know that the media loves putting Harry together with any girl that is around him”

“Yes, I know it, I’m his personal assistant and I read every article about him. But I am his bloody girlfriend and I know people don’t know that, but I’m sick of living in the background”

“Oh, love, if I knew it makes you upset, I don’t bring it up” you sat down on your bed finally and almost started crying.

“No, I’m overreacting, but I don’t know how long I can go like this”

“I’m sorry, love”

“What did you wanna say?”

“Actually that Kacey looks weird on that picture, like she was a wax figure” she said and you chuckled a bit.

“I thought you’re gonna say they look like a perfect couple.”

“First, you’re paranoid. Second, I wouldn’t tell you that even if I thought that.”

“Thanks!”

“Now get out of your room and kiss your wonderful boyfriend. I’ll go and make a tea to watch a romantic movie to fall asleep on”

“Thank you for calling”

“Anytime, darling” you hung up and went to see Harry. He was still in his room. You walked in and he was lying on the bed still. He was reading a book.

“Good morning, love” he said with a husky voice. You didn’t say anything but kissed him.

“Mmm, I missed that” he said with eyes brighter than the sun.

“Come on, let’s have breakfast”

After breakfast everyone left to Hershey. The trip was filled with work mostly. Everyone was occupied. Harry was working hard with Jeff, but he promised that the evening is yours. You didn’t mind, because you were with Sarah and Clare that afternoon, rehearsing your surprise for the karaoke party. You even chose the right outfits for it and ordered it. You made a little choreography for the song you wanted to perform. It was the kind of fun you missed. You were with Harry almost 24/7, and you missed being silly with girls. Time flew and it was 7 already. The girls left your room a half an hour ago and Harry promised to come at 7. You were sitting on your bed, waiting for him. It was 7.15 when you got up and started walking around. A sigh left your mouth when he rushed in.

“I’m so sorry, I was on the phone” he apologized while he walked in with your favourite sweets in his hands. He gave you a kiss and then sat down with you on the bed. You agreed on watching While You Were Sleeping. You cuddled in bed until you fell asleep. You couldn’t tell if he stayed the night, because he was out by the morning.

As you arrived early in Hershey Park Stadium, you saw that Harry is already there. He was playing baseball with some of the crew members. This venue was open-air so it was a bit different from the others. But you loved it, the sun was shining and it brought you a better mood that you were in yesterday. Harry waved to you as he saw you. You waved back. You met Jeff as you went backstage.

“Good morning” he said.

“Good morning”

“Did Harry call you?”

“No, but I saw him playing outside”

“I mean Lambert”

“Oh, no. Haven’t talked with him in the last few days”

“I think he’s gonna call you now” he smiled.

“Okay?” it was more of a question. You didn’t know what this is about, but you sat down next to Jeff and jumped into work immediately. You were working together this day. After a half an hour Harry walked in.

“Heey!” you heard him. He walked behind you and kissed the top of your head.

“What are you working at?” He sat down beside you.

“Right now? Making appointments for a check up. Everyone needs to be tested again” you said.

“So I have to stop with drugs, right?” he joked. He leaned very close to your ear. You felt his breath on your skin. “But you’re my only drug” he whispered. You blushed a bit.

“Then don’t ever stop with that” you whispered back. He smirked. He left you two to finish work. You smiled and thought maybe you could work it through and it felt good. A little later you saw Harry widely smiling and laughing a bit far from you. You smiled but then you saw that he’s with Kacey again. You realized that you haven’t seen that kind of smile on his face recently when he was with you. It made your heart break. Jeff noticed that your mood turned upside down in one second.

“y/n, you can tell me what’s going on. I won’t tell Harry if you don’t want me to.”

“I don’t know Jeff, I don’t feel what I used to feel. I’m insecure all the time” you said.

“I think it’s because of the messages, but it was just a psycho’s game. Talk to him. You know him. You know you can talk to him” he advised.

“I can’t, Jeff. That’s the problem. I can’t even talk to him like that.”

“In my opinion it would be better if you’d try. Or write it down, but let him know how you feel” he said.

“Okay” you sighed.  As time passed and you finished the paperwork, you walked through the place and watched as the crew members work hard on preparing the venue for the show. Sarah waved to you and you walked to her. She sat on one of the seats.

“Hey, girl!” she said.

“Hey! What’s up?” you sat down next to her.

“I loved yesterday afternoon. I think the karaoke party will be so much fun” she said.

“Oh, yeah! Was it your idea?”

“Yeah, then I told Clare that we should do it together. She loved it. And we loved your idea about the matching outfits”

“Thanks” you smiled.

“You got used to be in matching clothes with Harry, right?”

“Yeah” you chuckled.

“Look, it’s none of my business, but you two don’t seem to be madly in love. Is it because you don’t want to expose your relationship, or you distanced?” she asked. You sighed and looked down at your hands.

“I… we… I want… I think we distanced a bit. There was something going on recently”

“Is it something to do with Mike? I heard that he was taken by the police and I haven’t seen him since”

“Uhm, yeah. But it’s confidential, so I can’t tell you details. But it ruined us a bit and we still haven’t talk it through. I mean, I thought we’ll get closer by the time and stuff but it seems we’re just drifting away from each other” you admitted.

“No, I don’t want that. You are a great pair. I already planned double dates with you two and Mitch” she said. You chuckled a bit.

“That would be nice, if we’re still together after tour”

“I don’t want t hear anything like that. You’re gonna solve it, I’m sure” she said. You wanted to react but you saw the sound engineer wave to you to come down. You went together and soundcheck started.

Harry smiled at you several times and you tried your best to smile back. It was hard with Kacey next to you. At some point you were doubting Harry smiles at you or Kacey. As soundcheck finished you got dressed in the most beautiful skirt you’ve ever seen. It was the same colour as Harry’s suit tonight. As you walked out of your dressing room you saw Harry by the stage but still in the back. He stood there like a dream. Kacey was on stage, doing the pre-show and he watched it. You saw Helene capture the moment, you smiled. You wanted to go and hug him casually but you knew that anyone could see you in a venue like this. You were sure even some fans saw Harry standing there. When he saw you watching him, he waved you to go there. You stood next to him.

“You know that I love you, right?” he asked still looking at the show. You looked at him and he looked at you. You couldn’t answer and he saw that in your eyes.

“I love you, Harry” you said and you both turned your eyes back to the stage as Kacey finished her last song. Harry walked away to get ready and you just stayed there in your beautiful luxury clothes in a sold out venue watching your boyfriend, Harry Styles and you thought you should be happy. But you felt empty. You almost started crying, but you felt a hand on your back. You turned right and Louis stood there smiling. You smiled back. You were so emotional at that point that you hugged him tight.

“Oi, girl” he chuckled. He stayed with you the whole show and you two danced together to the songs. And when you cried during Sign of the Times, Just a Little Bit of Your Heart, Sweet Creature, If I Could Fly he gave you a tissue every time. After Harry did the whale he ran off stage and stopped by you. He was hyped and smiled widely.

“Did you enjoy it?” he asked.

“A lot” you smiled and gave a kiss on his cheek. You three went back to the hotel together. When you were in the car, Louis spoke up.

“Guys, I wanted to tell you that I gotta go back to the UK tomorrow. I’ll try to come back as often as I can, but I got a great opportunity” he said.

“What?”

“I was offered a seat in the X-Factor judges” he smiled.

“Oh my!” you were surprised.

“Wow! That’s great. With Simon?” Harry asked.

“Yeah, it’s funny, right?”

“It’s hilarious and amazing” Harry added.

“I’m gonna miss you both” Lou said.

You were quite sad that he leaves because you became good friends since you first met him. And now in this weird situation with Harry you wanted Lou to stay, but it was amazing that he’s gonna be a judge in the X-Factor. You packed up everything and traveled overnight again to Philadelphia. You slept in Harry’s arms in the car, but it felt weird this time.

“I don’t want t hear anything like that. You’re gonna solve it, I’m sure” she said. You wanted to react but you saw the sound engineer wave to you to come down. You went together and soundcheck started.

Harry smiled at you several times and you tried your best to smile back. It was hard with Kacey next to you. At some point you were doubting Harry smiles at you or Kacey. As soundcheck finished you got dressed in the most beautiful skirt you’ve ever seen. It was the same colour as Harry’s suit tonight. As you walked out of your dressing room you saw Harry by the stage but still in the back. He stood there like a dream. Kacey was on stage, doing the pre-show and he watched it. You saw Helene capture the moment, you smiled. You wanted to go and hug him casually but you knew that anyone could see you in a venue like this. You were sure even some fans saw Harry standing there. When he saw you watching him, he waved you to go there. You stood next to him.

“You know that I love you, right?” he asked still looking at the show. You looked at him and he looked at you. You couldn’t answer and he saw that in your eyes.

“I love you, Harry” you said and you both turned your eyes back to the stage as Kacey finished her last song. Harry walked away to get ready and you just stayed there in your beautiful luxury clothes in a sold out venue watching your boyfriend, Harry Styles and you thought you should be happy. But you felt empty. You almost started crying, but you felt a hand on your back. You turned right and Louis stood there smiling. You smiled back. You were so emotional at that point that you hugged him tight.

“Oi, girl” he chuckled. He stayed with you the whole show and you two danced together to the songs. And when you cried during Sign of the Times, Just a Little Bit of Your Heart, Sweet Creature, If I Could Fly he gave you a tissue every time. After Harry did the whale he ran off stage and stopped by you. He was hyped and smiled widely.

“Did you enjoy it?” he asked.

“A lot” you smiled and gave a kiss on his cheek. You three went back to the hotel together. When you were in the car, Louis spoke up.

“Guys, I wanted to tell you that I gotta go back to the UK tomorrow. I’ll try to come back as often as I can, but I got a great opportunity” he said.

“What?”

“I was offered a seat in the X-Factor judges” he smiled.

“Oh my!” you were surprised.

“Wow! That’s great. With Simon?” Harry asked.

“Yeah, it’s funny, right?”

“It’s hilarious and amazing” Harry added.

“I’m gonna miss you both” Lou said.

You were quite sad that he leaves because you became good friends since you first met him. And now in this weird situation with Harry you wanted Lou to stay, but it was amazing that he’s gonna be a judge in the X-Factor. You packed up everything and traveled overnight again to Philadelphia. You slept in Harry’s arms in the car, but it felt weird this time.
